title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, reduce the number of paragraphs, specify staff requirements, and outline activities that can be carried out directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. The Office of Environmental Education is established under the Act. SEC. 3. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GRANTS amended to reduce funding for lobbying activities. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments include updating the table of contents and references to the sections in various parts of the Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by updating references to sections in the Act, such as changing "section 9 of this Act" to "section 8" and "section 10(d) of this Act" to "section 9(d)". SEC. 5. National Education Awards. The Administrator may provide awards known as the President's Environmental Youth Awards to students in grades K-12 for outstanding projects promoting local environmental awareness. SEC. 6. Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act amends the Advisory Council membership to include representatives from various sectors, opens Task Force membership to federal agencies engaged in environmental education, and updates the composition of the Council. The National Environmental Education Act amends the Advisory Council membership to include representatives from various sectors and opens Task Force membership to federal agencies engaged in environmental education. The Advisory Council will now hold biennial meetings on timely environmental education issues and issue a report on the proceedings. The National Environmental Education Act establishes the National Environmental Education and Training Foundation. The National Environmental Education Act changes the name of the foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and makes conforming amendments to reflect the new name. The National Environmental Education Act renames the foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and updates various sections to reflect the new name. The National Environmental Education Act amends the number of directors on the Board of Directors from 13 to 19 and removes paragraph (3) regarding conditions of donations. The National Environmental Education Act amends the number of directors on the Board of Directors from 13 to 19 and removes paragraph (3) regarding conditions of donations. Authorization of appropriations is granted in Section 8. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funding allocations include $10,000,000 annually for various activities, with specific limitations on usage percentages for different programs. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007, with specific funding allocations and usage percentages for different programs. For example, a minimum of 40 percent is designated for environmental education grants, and 10 percent for the Foundation for Environmental Education. Administrative expenses are capped at 25 percent of the total amount available for the Office of Environmental Education activities. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of the Act.
